intro: Hieracium lividulifolium, commonly known as the bluish-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, bluish-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and it typically grows in grassy areas and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
